text: Auzata semipavonaria is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Francis Walker in 1863. It is found in northern India. The wingspan is 38-51.2 mm for males and 45.2-51.4 mm for females. Adults are similar to Auzata chinensis, but there are no black scales on the anterior part of the comma- shaped marking on the upperside of the forewings., 1959: "A revision of the genus Auzata Walker (Lepidoptera, Drepanidae)". Bonner Zoologische Beiträge 9: 232-258. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1863 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of India
title: Auzata semipavonaria
